definition: theism (the belief in the existence of God)
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
God/abbr. for 神舟[Shen2 zhou1]
deity/soul/spirit/unusual/mysterious/lively/expressive/expression/look/CL:個|个[ge4]/(slang) awesome/amazing
abbr. for 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], The Analects (of Confucius)
opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)
theist (believer in one or more Deities)

sentences.english: Theism is harmful to society, as it leads to intolerance and persecution.
sentences.chinese: 有神论，是对社会有害，因为它会导致不宽容和迫害。
这点，有些有神论不同意。

sentences.english: The usual theism is more insipid.
sentences.chinese: 平常的有神论则更淡而无味了。

sentences.english: Theism generally comes packaged in a religion.
sentences.chinese: 有神论一般都夹杂在宗教之中。

sentences.english: Theism , and let me be hope.
sentences.chinese: 而有神论则让我受到了希望。

sentences.english: At least, for me, to belong to a religion was so difficult and.
sentences.chinese: 我决定我是一个有神论者，无宗教者。

definition: atheism
pantheism, theological theory equating God with the Universe
monotheism/unitarianism (denying the Trinity)
materialism, philosophical doctrine that physical matter is the whole of reality
polytheism
monotheistic religion/monotheism
the philosophy of materialism, doctrine that physical matter is the whole of reality
philosophy of idealism, the doctrine that external reality is a product of consciousness
materialistic
philosophy of idealism, the doctrine that external reality is a product of consciousness
agnosticism, the philosophical doctrine that some questions about the universe are in principle unanswerable
deism, theological theory of God who does not interfere in the Universe
dualism, belief that the universe is made of two different substance (e.g. mind and matter or good and evil)
creationism (religion)
atheist
creationism (religion)
